contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:KG''' is the entry for [[Kyrgyzstan]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Kyrgyzstan, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[provinces of Kyrgyzstan|1 city and 7 regions]]. The city [[Bishkek]] is the capital of the country and has special status equal to the regions. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>KG</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Kyrgyzstan. The second part is either of the following: * one letter: regions * two letters: city ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). [[ISO 639-1]] codes are used to represent subdivision names in the following [[official language|administrative language]]s: * (ky): [[Kyrgyz language|Kirghiz]] * (ru): [[Russian language|Russian]] — Romanization system: [[BGN/PCGN romanization of Russian|BGN/PCGN]] 1947, [[GOST 16876-71|GOST]] 1983 ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name ([[Kyrgyz language|ky]]) ! Subdivision name ([[Russian language|ru]])<br /> (BGN/PCGN) ! Subdivision name ([[Russian language|ru]])<br /> (GOST) ! Subdivision category |- | <tt>KG-GB</tt> | [[Bishkek]] | Gorod Bishkek | Gorod Biškek | city |- | <tt>KG-B</tt> | [[Batken Province|Batken]] | Batkenskaya oblast' | Batkenskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KG-C</tt> | [[Chü Province|Chü]] | Chuyskaya oblast' | {{sort|Cujskaja oblast'|Čujskaja oblast'}} | region |- | <tt>KG-J</tt> | [[Jalal-Abad Province|Jalal-Abad]] | Dzhalal-Abadskaya oblast' | Džalal-Abadskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KG-N</tt> | [[Naryn Province|Naryn]] | Narynskaya oblast' | Narynskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KG-O</tt> | [[Osh Province|Osh]] | Oshskaya oblast' | Ošskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KG-T</tt> | [[Talas Province|Talas]] | Talasskaya oblast' | Talasskaja oblast' | region |- | <tt>KG-Y</tt> | [[Ysyk-Köl Province|Ysyk-Köl]] | Issyk-Kul'skaya oblast' | Issyk-Kul'skaja oblast' | region |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Addition of one region and one city. One spelling correction | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>KG-GB</tt> [[Bishkek]]<br /> <tt>KG-B</tt> [[Batken Province|Batken]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Kyrgyzstan]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (J-L)#KG: Kyrgyzstan|FIPS region codes of Kyrgyzstan]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/ukg.html Regions of Kyrgyzstan], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Kg}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:KG]] [[Category:Provinces of Kyrgyzstan|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Kyrgyzstan-related lists]]
